name: reactotron
description: A desktop app for inspecting your React JS and React Native projects.

scripts.e2e: npm run bootstrap && npm run build && npm run lint && npm run copy-internal-deps && npm run test

releases.name: Overlays in React Native
releases.body:
## Features
- Image overlays in React Native - @skellock #323
- Immutable JS support - @rmevans9 #315 

## Support
- Documentation updates - #300 by @jamonholmgren, #307 by @haikyuu

## How To Upgrade

Bump your `reactotron-*` dependencies up to `1.7.0` in your `package.json`.  

If you'd like to take advantage of the new `overlay` plugin for React Native, you can make these changes in your `ReactotronConfig.js`:

``` js
import Reactotron, { overlay } from 'reactotron-react-native'

// then down below where you configure your Reactotron plugins, add...

  .use(overlay())

```

There's a download link for the new Reactotron app down below.  It will be available on `brew` shortly.

releases.name: Small Redux Fixes
releases.body:
## Fixes
- Fixes bug with subscribing to the root of the redux state tree - #302 by @skellock and @codeithuman
- Support Redux Dev Tools with their action wrapping - #299 by @rmevans9 

## How to upgrade

If you're using `reactotron-redux`, just bump that up to `1.6.1`.

No other libraries or the the app was upgraded.

releases.name: Tasty Exceptions!
releases.body:
![screenshot-for-1 6](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/68273/20952377/ef2304d2-bbf9-11e6-8f36-c16ba454afa1.jpg)

## Features
- Sane stack traces in redux-saga! @rmevans9 #278
- With `reportError`, you can track errors in your catch statements.  #291 @rmevans9 @skellock
- Errors now show the source code that it bombed on. @skellock #284
- Click on errors to open in editor (React Native). @skellock  #284
- Errors now look much nicer. @skellock  #284

## Changes
- Upgrades to `apisauce@0.7.0` (`axios@0.15.3`) #294 by @skellock

## Upgrading

Bump your `reactotron-*` dependencies up to `1.6.0` in your `package.json`.  

If you'd like to take advantage of the new `openInEditor` plugin for React Native, you can make these changes in your `ReactotronConfig.js`:

``` js
import Reactotron, { trackGlobalErrors, openInEditor } from 'reactotron-react-native'

// then down below where you configure your Reactotron plugins, add...

  .use(openInEditor())

```

There's a download link for the new Reactotron app down below.  It will be available on `brew` shortly.

releases.name: Socket.io Upgraded Us Into Oblivion
releases.body:
## Fixes
- Socket.io had moved the location of one of their libraries.  Hilarity ensued.  #279 by @ricardofbarros .
- Added a `{safeRecursion: false}` to `configure()` to opt-out of circular dependency checking.  This will help if you have massive payloads being sent over to Reactotron.  #281 by @skellock.

## How to Upgrade

Bump any of your `reactotron-*` libraries in your projects up to `1.5.3`.

`yarn upgrade-interactive` is pretty great for that.

## What version is the App?

It's still `1.5.0`.  ❤️

releases.name: Circular Deps, Function Names, and Bad Saga Names
releases.body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/68273/20435057/8d476f80-ad78-11e6-83bb-57dd0d6cb520.png)

## Fixes
- show the saga description instead of `undefined` when showing non-iterator yielded tasks - #267 by @rmevans9
- support for circular dependencies - #264 by @skellock
- support for showing function names - #264 by @skellock

## Support
- fixed note about wrong name for `source-map` - #265 by @nhducit

## Upgrade Notes

In your app, just upgrade the appropriate libraries you're using.  All of these have now `1.5.2` versions:
- `reactotron-apisauce`
- `reactotron-react-native`
- `reactotron-react-js`
- `reactotron-redux`
- `reactotron-redux-saga`

No code changes are required if you're coming from `1.5.x`.

releases.name: Support redux-saga 0.13
releases.body:
## Fix
- makes `reactotron-redux-saga` compatible with `redux-saga@0.13` #260 by @rmevans9

The 0.13 release of `redux-saga` earlier this morning changed the interface for their sagaMonitors to require an additional function that must exist.

releases.name: Timeline Filtering
releases.body:
![reactotron 1 5](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/68273/20304194/fa78aee4-aafc-11e6-97f3-1dd935e1f2da.jpg)

## Features
- filter which messages are shown in the app by @rmevans9 and @skellock

## Fixes
- rounds the duration to milliseconds #252 by @rmevans9
- fixes a typo in saga effects title #256 by @patricksmith
- supports sagas immediately forked from the root saga #258 by @skellock

## Support
- updated old download link #248 by @fvonhoven
- corrected wrong function name in `reactotron-redux-saga` docs #246 by @tsemerad

releases.name: Hello Redux Saga!
releases.body:
![reactotron 1 4](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/68273/20165589/b9b4fc10-a6dc-11e6-8889-824e565748fb.jpg)

## Features
- adds [Redux Saga](https://github.com/yelouafi/redux-saga) support ([#235](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/235)) by [@skellock](https://github.com/skellock)
- pass the current state to onRestore for partial restoring ([#233](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/233)) by [@rmevans9](https://github.com/rmevans9)
- adds Windows and Linux friendly keystrokes ([#232](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/232)) by [@skellock](https://github.com/skellock)

releases.name: Redux Fixes And Config Overhaul
releases.body:
## Fixes
- fixed an issue where dispatching request might not work ([#230](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/230)) by [@skellock](https://github.com/skellock)
- fixed an issue where displaying actions triggered by sagas might not show ([#230](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/230)) by [@skellock](https://github.com/skellock)
- fixed the complicated setup requirements of integrating with Redux ([#230](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/230)) by [@skellock](https://github.com/skellock)

## Note

This updates `reactotron-redux` only.  I do recommend upgrading as it's pretty silly bug fix.  To take advantage of this fix, you'll also need to change how you integrate with Redux.

Configuration is now moved into your `ReactotronConfig.js` file with the rest of the configuration. :tada:

You now use `Reactotron.createStore(myReducer, myEnhancer)` to create build your store.

Here's two examples:

React JS: [Reactotron Setup](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/blob/master/packages/demo-react-js/src/ReactotronConfig.js#L10) and  [Store Setup](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/blob/master/packages/demo-react-js/src/Redux/Store.js#L28)
React Native: [Reactotron Setup](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/blob/master/packages/demo-react-native/App/Config/ReactotronConfig.js#L9) and [Store Setup](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/blob/master/packages/demo-react-native/App/Redux/index.js#L33)

[The documentation](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/blob/master/docs/plugin-redux.md) has also been updated.

releases.name: State Snapshots + Clearing
releases.body:
![reactotron 1 3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/68273/20165753/0d77581a-a6de-11e6-8746-338917218509.jpg)

## Features
- upload & download snapshots of your state! ([#224](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/224)) by [@skellock](https://github.com/skellock)
- support for clearing Reactotron from your app ([#223](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/223)) by [@skellock](https://github.com/skellock)
- added a button to clear Reactotron ([#223](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/223)) by [@skellock](https://github.com/skellock)

releases.name: Upgraded Dependencies + Android Love
releases.body:
## Features
- autodetect IP address on android emulators ([#203](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/203)) by [@jhen0409](https://github.com/jhen0409)
- use Fira Code font if it's available ([#207](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/207)) by [@skellock](https://github.com/skellock)

## Support

- document fixes & content ([#194](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/194) [#201](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/201) [#202](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/202)) by [@idoo](https://github.com/idoo), [@hybrisCole](https://github.com/hybrisCole), [@gantman](https://github.com/gantman)

releases.name: React DOM Dependency Loosen Up
releases.body:
## Support
- switch to peer dependencies for `react` and `react-dom` on `reactotron-react-js`
- switch from `^15.3.0` to `>=15.3.0` for `react` and `react-dom` on `reactotron-react-js`

releases.name: React Native Dependency Loosen Up
releases.body:
## Support
- loosens the React Native dependency to prevent downstream warnings (`reactotron-react-native` only)

releases.name: More Classic Steve
releases.body: - Updates the version number which appears in the About screen (App only... not a necessary upgrade, I just messed up)

releases.name: Image Support and Documentation Overhaul
releases.body:
## Features
- image support - http & inline base64 ([#182](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/182)) by [@skellock](https://github.com/skellock)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/68273/18027393/5fed6622-6c30-11e6-87d3-471fe74dd544.png)
- CLI can show display commands ([#183](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/183)) by [@skellock](https://github.com/skellock)

## Fixes
- fixes app on case-sensitivity filesystems ([#170](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/170)) by [@kenshaw](https://github.com/kenshaw)
- NPM 2.x compatibility ([#179](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/179)) by [@vjpr](https://github.com/vjpr) & [@skellock](https://github.com/skellock)

## Support
- Homebrew Cask installer ([#164](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/164)) by [@jsynowiec](https://github.com/jsynowiec)
- [Infinite Red](https://infinite.red) sponsorship <3 ([#169](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/169)) by [@skellock](https://github.com/skellock)
- demo apps dependency refresh, screenshot example, dev-dependency examples, & Symbol polyfill  ([#180](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/180), [#181](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/181), [#165](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/165)) by [@skellock](https://github.com/skellock)
- documentation updates ([#166](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/166), [#175](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/175), [#176](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/176), [#177](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/177)) by [@ReadmeCritic](https://github.com/ReadmeCritic), [@patricksmith](https://github.com/patricksmith), [@jamonholmgren](https://github.com/jamonholmgren), [@skellock](https://github.com/skellock)

releases.name: Classic Steve
releases.body: - Only affects `reactotron-cli`.   Now it contains the `#!` part of the script that allows it to run.

releases.name: Desktop App + Plugin System
releases.body:
Reactotron now has a desktop app in addition to the CLI!

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/68273/17913184/6295ecae-6966-11e6-882b-faca055e4389.png)

There's also a brand new plugin system which makes it much easier to extend and customize.

releases.name: I feel pretty.  Oh so pretty.
releases.body:
- Adds tabs and a help screen. [@skellock](https://github.com/skellock) ([#147](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/147))

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/68273/17843375/3e72ae14-67fb-11e6-873f-c216119cb2b5.png)
- Support for user-generated commands. [@skellock](https://github.com/skellock) ([#146](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/146))

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/68273/17843379/553d900a-67fb-11e6-99f9-162922489b0e.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/68273/17843383/641aa25c-67fb-11e6-8d9c-b814e8ba3eec.png)

- Adds subscriptions to the timeline. [@skellock](https://github.com/skellock) ([#140](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/140))
- Upgrades subscription messages to diffs. [@skellock](https://github.com/skellock) ([#143](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/143))

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/68273/17843397/86218f00-67fb-11e6-9eaf-6cbd286f330f.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/68273/17843402/975bfc56-67fb-11e6-959c-c7c5beae63b5.png)

- Replay action button. [@skellock](https://github.com/skellock) ([#139](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/139))

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/68273/17843416/ad0563da-67fb-11e6-8433-8d9b15a945c0.png)

- Adds always on top to the menu. [@skellock](https://github.com/skellock) ([#137](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/137))

releases.name: Help Screen & Important Actions
releases.body:
- We have a help screen (command + /) and a new core contributor! [@gantman](https://github.com/gantman) ([#133](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/133))

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/68273/17786994/64aaa81e-6555-11e6-8ff7-bc08e6f7dab6.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/68273/17786985/5f48b082-6555-11e6-9254-d88f35ae2c21.png)
- Adds an electron code-signing script. [@skellock](https://github.com/skellock) ([#136](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/pull/136))

releases.name: Can't Stop Now.  This is Bat Country.
releases.body:
Here's the super quick starting notes.  

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/68273/17691242/6cf8e03a-6361-11e6-8ef2-84b900af5e05.png)

### Running Reactotron.app
- [Download](https://github.com/reactotron/reactotron/releases/download/v0.92.0/Reactotron.app.zip) the pre-release.  Mac OS X 64-bit only.  That's probably you.
- Unzip.
- Double click Reactotron.app 

### Keystrokes
- `cmd-f` = find Redux keys or values (use tab to toggle)
- `cmd-n` = subscribe to a Redux path
- `cmd-d` = dispatch a Redux action
- `cmd-k` = klear!

### Running A Sample App

Ain't no-one got time to write a sample app.  Here's a prepackaged one!

```
cd ~/safeplace
git clone git@github.com:reactotron/reactotron.git
git checkout next
cd packages/demo-react-native
npm i
react-native run-ios
```

### Other Things
- Not compatible with `reactotron 0.9.0` and below.
- The cli is still there!  `cd packages/reactotron-cli && npm i && npm start`

### Next Steps
- Triple check all deps and lerna workarounds to ensure nice env for devs
- Bugz bugz bugz
- Polish
- Docs
- Demos
- Videos
- `NEW` supports secure option for using wss - [@ridersx](https://github.com/ridersx) [(#98)](https://github.com/skellock/reactotron/pull/98)

- `NEW` support Symbol as Redux action types - [@fantasywind](https://github.com/fantasywind) [(#66)](https://github.com/skellock/reactotron/pull/66)
- `FIX` prevents sending empty subscription messages - [@skellock](https://github.com/skellock) [(#67)](https://github.com/skellock/reactotron/pull/67)

- `NEW` android ip auto-detection support! - [@jhen0409](https://github.com/jhen0409)
- `NEW` adds an example to the dispatch modal - [@darinwilson](https://github.com/darinwilson)
- `NEW` updates the React DOM example to this century - [@skellock](https://github.com/skellock)

- `FIX` adds compatibility with Node 4.x and npm 2.x - thx [@skellock](https://github.com/skellock) - found by [@maraujop](https://github.com/maraujop) and [@avioli](https://github.com/avioli)
- `MOD` no longer using `fbjs` for `performanceNow()` - thx [@skellock](https://github.com/skellock) - found by [@avioli](https://github.com/avioli)

- `NEW` adds a way to do benchmarks - thx [@skellock](https://github.com/skellock)
- `NEW` press `c` to see connected clients - thx [@andrewvy](https://github.com/andrewvy)

- `NEW` additional details about the client are now shown when connecting - thx [@andrewvy](https://github.com/andrewvy)
- `NEW` client count is shown in status bar - thx [@andrewvy](https://github.com/andrewvy)
- `NEW` a simpler way to integrate redux with an enhancer - thx [@andrewvy](https://github.com/andrewvy)
- `FIX` adds a .babelrc to the react native example app
- `FIX` the redux action timer is showing the correct times again
- `MOD` adds a working Android example app
- `DOC` made a note about ensuring `connect()` gets triggered first in your app

- `NEW` a way to configure options on the client - thx [@gantman](https://github.com/gantman)
- `NEW` a master switch to turn off everything in 1 spot - thx [@gantman](https://github.com/gantman)
- `FIX` fixed the optional user agent assignment issues

- `NEW` a help menu to show key commands - thx [@gantman](https://github.com/gantman)
- `NEW` emoji logging 🎉
- `NEW` the client is now transpiled for easy integration into React DOM - found by [@derekyau](https://github.com/derekyau) and [@Hyra](https://github.com/Hyra)
- `MOD` returns the redux store from `addReduxStore` - thx [@gantman](https://github.com/gantman)
- `FIX` stop clobbering the window.navigator - found by [@kevinvangelder](https://github.com/kevinvangelder)
- `FIX` separated the examples to prevent colliding deps - found by [@gantman](https://github.com/gantman)
- `DOC` README updates - thx [@gantman](https://github.com/gantman) and [@darinwilson](https://github.com/darinwilson)

- `NEW` supports React DOM
- `NEW` supports React Native Web - thx [@necolas](https://github.com/necolas)
- `NEW` initial release
